sense.name: payment or compensation in return for service
sense.commentary: REWARD[+quantity][+payment][+remuneration/+offer] Note: implies the payment is always given for work completed.
sense.examples: The salesman received a $50,000 bonus as his reward for exceeding his annual target. Another reward of this company is six weeks of paid vacation.

sense.name: a reinforcement stimulus to guide behavior
sense.examples: The rats receive a reward of a food pellet each time they strike the bar. His reward for making such an impudent remark was a slap on the cheek.

sense.name: an offer for delivering or returning something
sense.commentary: REWARD[+quantity][+payment][+offer/+remuneration] Note: does not imply the payment is always given, different from sense 1
sense.examples: There is a $100,000 reward on his head, dead or alive. She is offering a reward for the return of her diamond ring.

sense.name: a benefit or advantage gained
sense.commentary: REWARD[+state][+benefit] Note: value or benefit broadly defined, not just financial
sense.examples: Mary is enjoying the rewards of motherhood. He has decided to pursue the greater risks and rewards of being an entrepreneur. Pete finds no reward in playing one-upmanship at work.
